results.deck: Shoot cowboys, robots, gangsters, and zombies, while trying to impress your fickle director in this rail shooter for the PlayStation Move.
results.name: The Shoot

results.deck: An enhanced hack-and-slash PSP game following Dynasty Warriors Strikeforce, with different chararacters and story.
results.name: Shin Sangoku Musou: Multi Raid 2

results.deck: Dirt 3 is the latest installment in Codemasters' long-running Colin McRae Rally franchise. The game returns to the series' rally roots with dynamic weather, a career focusing on team-based racing, as well as introducing the freestyle event: Gymkhana.
results.name: DiRT 3

results.deck: Two mercenaries, E'lara and Caddoc, go in search of an artifact that Caddoc had a vision about that could save humanity or threaten its survival.
results.name: Hunted: The Demon's Forge

results.deck: Spider-Man: Shattered Dimensions revolves around the pieces of a magical tablet, spanning four distinct dimensions and starring the Spider-Men therein.
results.name: Spider-Man: Shattered Dimensions

results.deck: A hack-and-slash action-RPG featuring cooperative multiplayer developed by Snowblind Studios under the Lord of the Rings license. The game draws on both literary and movie influences to tell the story of three warriors fighting in the North of Middle Earth concurrently with the events of the books/movies.
results.name: The Lord of the Rings: War in the North

results.deck: Killzone 3 continues the story of the invasion of the planet Helghan by the oppressive forces of the merciless Interplanetary Strategic Alliance. The game also features an improved multiplayer progression system and refined classes.
results.name: Killzone 3

results.deck: A procedurally-generated game of world exploration, resource harvesting, and freeform construction. It supports local and online multiplayer, and is regularly updated with new content and features.
results.name: Minecraft

results.deck: Developed by Day 1 Studios, F.3.A.R. (pronounced "Fear Three") is the final chapter in the F.E.A.R. franchise and continues the twisted story of Alma Wade and her two sons, Paxton Fettel and the Point Man.
results.name: F.E.A.R. 3

results.deck: The fifth main iteration in the long-running Persona series, featuring a group of high school students and a cat who moonlight as phantom thieves who can steal hearts. Like its predecessors, it combines elements of turn-based, dungeon-crawling role-playing games with simulation-style visual novels, now rendered in high-definition, cel-shaded 3D for the first time.
results.name: Persona 5

results.deck: A game based on the Sin City series of comics has been in development for several years, said to run on Epic's Unreal Engine 3.
results.name: Sin City

results.deck: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2 is a fighting game based on the popular anime and manga series, Naruto.
results.name: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2

results.deck: The visual novel series returns with Love Chu Chu.
results.name: Chaos;Head Love Chu Chu!

results.deck: A visual novel consisting mostly of static or animated photographs with live-action clips scattered throughout.
results.name: Imabikisō

results.deck: Sniper: Ghost Warrior is a military simulation game developed by CITY-interactive with focus on sniper activities like spotting enemies and honing sniper skills, including a 12 player multiplayer mode.
results.name: Sniper: Ghost Warrior

results.deck: Quiz about on wildlife using National Geographic content.
results.name: Nat Geo Quiz! Wild Life

results.deck: A video game based off of the musical anime K-On! The game is published by Sega.
results.name: K-On! After School Live!

results.deck: The fourth Monster Hunter game on PSP evolves the series by building on the best features from previous series entries, Monster Hunter Freedom Unite for PSP and Monster Hunter Tri for Wii.
results.name: Monster Hunter Portable 3rd

results.deck: Winning Post World 2010 is a horse racing simulation game developed by Koei. It is a part of the long running Winning Post series and was released in Japan on February 26, 2010.
results.name: Winning Post World 2010

results.deck: ACE R is the newest game in the robot-anime-based action series, created by From Software of Armored Core fame.
results.name: Another Century's Episode R

results.deck: The 2010 cricket game from Codemasters, licensed by the ECB, Cricket Australia and the MCC; International Cricket 2010 is the second cricket game to be released by Codemasters for the Playstation 3 and Xbox 360, following Ashes Cricket 2009.
results.name: International Cricket 2010

results.deck: Rather than being based on the SAW II movie, Flesh & Blood, like the first SAW videogame, is an original story set in the SAW universe.
results.name: SAW II: Flesh & Blood

results.deck: A lucha libre wrestling game sponsored by AAA, one of the larger pro wrestling organizations in Mexico.
results.name: Lucha Libre AAA Heroes del Ring

results.deck: The eighth game in the esteemed survival-horror franchise sees convict Murphy Pendleton escape captivity and flee into the much greater danger of the cursed town of Silent Hill.
results.name: Silent Hill: Downpour

results.deck: Owl-based action adventure game for Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, Wii and DS. It looks like a hoot! GET IT!?
results.name: The Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole

results.deck: Syndicate is a reinvention of the 1993 game by Bullfrog. Developed at Starbreeze Studios, the game puts players in the shoes of Miles Kilo, one of the cybernetically-enhanced Agents who wages war against enemy mega-corporations on behalf of EuroCorp, his sponsor syndicate.
results.name: Syndicate

results.deck: Coda is a free indie game featuring a unique melee combat system made on the Unreal Engine 3 UDK.
results.name: Coda

results.deck: A third-person, squad-based, tactical game that recounts humanity's first contact with aliens during the Cold War in the 1960s, and the subsequent founding of the XCOM organization.
results.name: The Bureau: XCOM Declassified

results.deck: A Shrek game based on the final Shrek film of the same name.
results.name: Shrek Forever After

results.deck: After a decade-long hiatus, Marvel vs. Capcom 3 continues the popular crossover fighting game series characterized by fast-paced gameplay, complex tag teams, and elaborate combos.
results.name: Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds

results.deck: Tony Hawk: SHRED is the successor to Tony Hawk: RIDE, a peripheral-based, motion-controlled skateboarding game. SHRED introduces a snowboarding mode to the series, as well as Xbox 360 Avatar support.
results.name: Tony Hawk: SHRED

results.deck: ATVs and MX Bikes engage top speeds through branching off-road tracks in this outlandish arcade racer.
results.name: Nail'd

results.deck: Ravensdale is an upcoming fantasy action game developed by Spellbound Entertainment.
results.name: Ravensdale

results.deck: This sequel to Dragon Age: Origins features faster combat, a new art style, and a brand new, fully voiced main character named Hawke.
results.name: Dragon Age II

results.deck: The 2010 edition of the very popular (in Japan) Nippon Professional League (NPB) baseball game. This year marks the series' last appearance on PlayStation 2 and first on PSP.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2010

results.deck: An updated version of Ketsui: Kizuna Jugoku Tachi released on April 22, 2010 for Xbox 360. A PS3 version was later released in 2013.
results.name: Ketsui: Kizuna Jigoku Tachi Extra

results.deck: Enhanced console port of the first-person party-based PSP dungeon crawler. School-based Fantasy story-line with quests built around dungeon-crawling and world exploration.
results.name: Class of Heroes 2G

results.deck: The third installment in the Assassin's Creed franchise, this game's story picks up right after the events of Assassin's Creed II, showing Ezio Auditore traveling to Rome to recruit a new force of assassins. Brotherhood is the first game in the series to offer online multiplayer.
results.name: Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood

results.deck: Ben 10 Ultimate Alien: Cosmic Destruction is the latest Ben 10 video game set during the events of Ben 10: Ultimate Alien.
results.name: Ben 10 Ultimate Alien: Cosmic Destruction

results.deck: The electric superhuman, Cole MacGrath, returns in the sequel to 2009's open world superhero third-person action game from Sucker Punch, featuring new graphics, a new city, and new powers.
results.name: inFamous 2

results.deck: Action-adventure air combat game set in the MySims universe.
results.name: MySims SkyHeroes

results.deck: Take to the skies in this Clancy-infused flight combat game.
results.name: Tom Clancy's H.A.W.X. 2

results.deck: Monopoly Streets reimagines the classic board game as a dynamic gameworld encountered from street level. As players buy and build up properties, they'll see actual buildings erected, styled in accordance with the neighborhoods' economic status.
results.name: Monopoly Streets

results.deck: LittleBigPlanet 2 expands the creation tools introduced in the first game, allowing user levels to diverge even more from the base gameplay. It also features a new story mode.
results.name: LittleBigPlanet 2

results.deck: Pro Evolution Soccer 2011, also known as Winning Eleven 2011, and usually shortened to PES 2011 or WE 2011, will be the new installment in Konami's strongly followed football (soccer) series. It will be released on September 30th in Europe, and on October 5th in the US.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2011

results.deck: SingStar: The Wiggles is a collection of popular songs from the Wiggles.  The Wiggles are an Australian children's band who have shared their music with kids around the world.
results.name: Singstar: The Wiggles

results.deck: Raging Blast 2 continues the next generation of Budokai Tenkaichi style of Dragon Ball fighting games.
results.name: Dragon Ball: Raging Blast 2

results.deck: A character action game in which the player takes on the role of Enoch, a virtuous mortal from Heaven who, in order to prevent a great flood, ventures to imprison the seven Fallen Angels that turned their back on God.
results.name: El Shaddai: Ascension of the Metatron

results.deck: The title was released on PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 and Wii, and features versions of The Game of Life, Clue, Twister, Mouse Trap, and Yahtzee Hands Down. The games is hosted by Mr. Potato Head, and players can use their Mii and Avatar on the Wii and Xbox
results.name: Hasbro Family Game Night 3

results.deck: A turn-based RPG for the PS3 by Compile Heart that has a Moe anthropomorphic representation of the Sega Neptune fighting alongside console-tans of the three major consoles against the evil Arfoire.
results.name: Hyperdimension Neptunia

results.deck: The Ape Escape franchise's debut on the PS3 is a departure for the series, switching to a mostly first person on-rails game that utilizes the PlayStation Move motion controller.
results.name: Ape Escape Move

results.deck: In Truth or Lies, players join family & friends in roundtable-style gameplay answering an wide array of thought-provoking questions. The game's built-in lie detector will let everyone know if the answers are truthful.
results.name: Truth or Lies

results.deck: A third-person action game in which Heinrich, a scythe wielding soldier, hacks and slashes his way through enemies to protect Gretchen, a witch who has cursed him with immortality.
results.name: Knights Contract

results.deck: The eleventh installment of the Atelier series and first of the Arland trilogy. Rorona has taken up the task to keep the alchemist workshop from closing by completing assignments issued by the Arland Kingdom.
results.name: Atelier Rorona: Alchemist of Arland

results.deck: EA's renamed basketball simulation set for an October 2010 release was cancelled at the last minute due to concerns over quality. The game was intended to introduce brand new control concepts and mechanics meant to innovate on the simulation basketball genre.
results.name: NBA Elite 11

results.deck: 2K's long-running basketball simulator is back for another season with Michael Jordan as their cover athlete.
results.name: NBA 2K11

results.deck: The sixth installment of the Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell series and follows the events after Splinter Cell: Conviction.
results.name: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Blacklist

results.deck: A new golf franchise developed by Gusto Games for the PS3, Xbox 360 and PC, this game stars the PGA Legend John Daly and will make use of the Playstation Move.
results.name: John Daly's ProStroke Golf

results.deck: A dance game from Ubisoft, featuring songs from various Broadway musicals. Players hold a Wii remote or Move controller and follow along with dance commands on screen.
results.name: Dance On Broadway

results.deck: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1 is the first of two games developed by EA Bright Light for the book and movie of the same name. Unlike previous Harry Potter titles, this game is more unique with extended features and graphics.
results.name: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1

results.deck: Tanner returns in this new Driver sequel. Set in San Francisco, the game actually takes place inside his coma stricken brain. This allows him to bend the rules of the road... and reality!
results.name: Driver: San Francisco

results.deck: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2011 is the twelfth installment of the popular wrestling series and introduces a brand new physics system to the gameplay as well as a new WWE Universe mode.
results.name: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2011

results.deck: Legends and current superstars go at it in this over-the-top wrestling game from THQ's San Diego studio.
results.name: WWE All Stars

results.deck: FIFA 11 is the yearly, best selling football (soccer) game by EA Sports. FIFA 11 features 11 v 11 online multiplayer and the ability to play as a goalkeeper.
results.name: FIFA 11

results.deck: Cars, motorcycles, monster trucks and more all race together through improvised tracks in an abandoned city destroyed by an earthquake, in the fourth instalment in the MotorStorm series.
results.name: MotorStorm: Apocalypse

results.deck: Activision & Field Motor Sports team up to bring you the latest game based on the Monster Jam license, Monster Jam 2011. Race 30 licensed trucks, or create your own, in 8 real stadiums.
results.name: Monster Jam: Path of Destruction

results.deck: Criterion's reboot of one of the most popular games in the Need for Speed series. The game features Racer versus Cop gameplay and can be played from either perspective at any time.
results.name: Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit

results.deck: 505 Games is publishing this M-rated take on Mixed Martial Arts.
results.name: Supremacy MMA

results.deck: Q Entertainment's music shooter for Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3. It features support for the Kinect and Move controllers, and is considered a spiritual successor to the cult classic, Rez.
results.name: Child of Eden

results.deck: Officially revealed at Ubisoft's 2010 E3 press briefing, Rayman Origins is a new 2D Rayman game developed by Michel Ancel and a small team, taking the series back to its roots.
results.name: Rayman Origins

results.deck: As a benevolent god known as 'the Breath', players must lead their people to safety and help them retrieve the lost knowledge of their ancestors by manipulating the shape of the terrain of the world in this spiritual successor to Populous.
results.name: From Dust

results.deck: Find out who's bad in this Ubisoft game based on the life of Michael Jackson.
results.name: Michael Jackson: The Experience

results.deck: Resident Evil: Revelations is a full, story-driven Resident Evil title for the Nintendo 3DS, in which Chris Redfield and Jill Valentine split up to investigate a new conspiracy, with new partners Parker and Jessica.
results.name: Resident Evil: Revelations

results.deck: Zumba Fitness is a fitness game that blends with a dance game to give you a proper workout. It is compatible with both the Kinect and the PlayStation Move.
results.name: Zumba Fitness

results.deck: Play a sorcerer's apprentice in this Playstation Move exclusive, Sorcery turns the Move into a real magic wand and has you performing various motions to cast spells.
results.name: Sorcery

results.deck: PlayStation Move Heroes is a mascot-based minigame collection starring the heroes and sidekicks from classic PlayStation franchises Ratchet & Clank, Jak & Daxter, and Sly Cooper.
results.name: PlayStation Move Heroes

results.deck: The long-running tournament-based vehicular manslaughter simulator returns with this new entry, exclusive to the Playstation 3.
results.name: Twisted Metal

results.deck: Journey is thatgamecompany's third release for Sony. Roam the lands discovering the history of an ancient civilization on a trek toward a distant mountain. Go at it alone or explore with strangers online.
results.name: Journey

results.deck: Developed by Feelplus and published by SquareEnix, assume the role of a "Wanderer" controlling the minds of enemies to turn the tide of battle.
results.name: Mindjack

results.deck: A first-party PlayStation Move title that mimics game like Boom Blox and Jenga, while having a flair of Tetris.
results.name: Tumble

results.deck: SingStar Dance adds PlayStation Move support to the popular karaoke series, which allows the game to track dance moves along with singing.
results.name: SingStar Dance

results.deck: The Sly Collection is a re-mastering of the Sly Cooper trilogy made available on a single Blu-ray disc. Along with HD graphics and trophies, the collection includes 3D support and new minigames with PlayStation Move support.
results.name: The Sly Collection

results.deck: Time Crisis: Razing Storm is an on-rails light gun game in which you battle military enemies, using assigned weaponry and a shield to block attacks. Known as Big 3 Gun Shooting in Japan.
results.name: Time Crisis: Razing Storm

results.deck: In this brutal action game from the creators of Alien vs. Predator, players become Bryce Boltsman, a demon hunter cursed with immortality five hundred years ago, who can survive being violently dismembered by his enemies as long as his head isn't swallowed whole.
results.name: NeverDead

results.deck: A revival of the classic trivia party game series.
results.name: You Don't Know Jack

results.deck: Sequel to Atelier Rorona and another installment of the Atelier franchise. In Atelier Totori, the story revolves around a girl named Totori, who plans to become an adventurer in hopes to find her mother who went missing years ago.
results.name: Atelier Totori: The Adventurer of Arland

results.deck: A karaoke-type game that uses the Kinect for the Xbox 360 and the PlayStation Eye for the PlayStation 3 to replace actors from television shows & movies with players, who then act and recite the lines to "put themselves in the movie."
results.name: Yoostar 2: In The Movies

results.deck: Sequel to the Agarest Senki, also known as Record of Agarest War in US.
results.name: Record of Agarest War 2

results.deck: The spiritual sequel to the classic Battle Chess, Check vs. Mate is based upon ChessBase's Fritz! chess algorithm software.
results.name: Check vs. Mate

results.deck: THQ is developing a game based off of the Shrek character, Puss in Boots. This will be released for the Wii, DS, PS3 and 360.
results.name: Puss in Boots

results.deck: Black Bean and Milestone combine to create a brand new contender for the top rally title, bearing the official FIA and WRC branding.
results.name: WRC: FIA World Rally Championship

results.deck: The sixth title in the Yakuza series, replacing the previous games' semi-realistic storyline with a 'what if' story about a zombie invasion, still starring Kazuma Kiryu and other major Yakuza characters.
results.name: Yakuza: Dead Souls

results.deck: "THE iDOLM@STER 2", the sequel to the popular "iDOLM@STER" series ("THE iDOLM@STER", "Live For You!"). A simulation game where the player takes on the role of an idol manager and raises their idols to stardom.
results.name: THE iDOLM@STER 2

results.deck: Tower is an upcoming game for Playstation Move. The game is expected to be released in 2011.
results.name: Tower

results.deck: Play as you're favorite teams from the NRL, Super League, State of Origin, City v Country, and World Cup.
results.name: Rugby League Live

results.deck: A new helicopter flight sim developed by Gaijin Entertainment and published by Activision.
results.name: Apache: Air Assault

results.deck: James Bond 007: Blood Stone is a third-person shooter developed by Bizarre Creations.
results.name: James Bond 007: Blood Stone

results.deck: A turn-based RPG for PC, PSN and XBLA in which the player controls either a fairy or an elf. The game was released on November 10, 2010 on XBLA and will be released later in 2010 on PSN and PC.
results.name: Faery: Legends of Avalon

results.deck: EA brings Fight Night back into the ring with an M-rating, depicting the "violence and brutality that is true to the trade."
results.name: Fight Night Champion
